meanings.definition: An extinct group of marine mollusks with a coiled, chambered shell.
meanings.sent1: The scientist found an ammonoid fossil on the beach.
meanings.sent2: Ammonoids lived in the ocean millions of years ago.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the seashell was an ancient ammonoid spaceship.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity about the ancient world was as deep as the chambers of an ammonoid shell.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed a perfectly preserved ammonoid for visitors to marvel at.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of ammonoids.
meanings.sent1: The researcher studied the unique features of the ammonoid species.
meanings.sent2: Ammonoid patterns could be seen in the fossilized rocks.
meanings.sent3: The artist created an amusing cartoon featuring colorful, cartoonish ammonoid characters.
meanings.sent4: Her room was decorated with curtains that reminded her of the swirling shapes of an ammonoid.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky in shades of pink and orange, resembling the hues of an ammonoid's shell.

meanings.definition: A fossilized shell of an ammonoid.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a rare, perfectly preserved ammonoid.
meanings.sent2: The collector added a beautiful ammonoid to his fossil collection.
meanings.sent3: The children played with toy dinosaurs and a small, plastic ammonoid shell.
meanings.sent4: The ancient artifact gleamed like a polished ammonoid shell.
meanings.sent5: The paleontologist carefully brushed the dirt off the delicate ammonoid fossil.
